Articles.Content:
I reinforce Death Star Two with Death Star 1 Also under a localized Sheild generator and ray Sheild generator. I Order the Eclipes and Executor to Reinforce each. Executor too the Death Star II.

I add a fleet of 1,000 Venators With 100 TIE Defenders on each for 100,000 Tie Defenders. And a reinforcement of 4 Imperial II Class Star Destroyers per each Venator.

Also 1/2 of all combat ships based on the Death Star I and II are deployed on patrol so no lucky shot

And only Death Star I would be gone 

Let alone the fact atleast 1,000 of the best ships are on your tail.

I look forward to your counter statement. Also note the Star Destroyers are tied to the Death Stars until in combat so they jump to hyperspace at the same time.

The spherical Death Star rolls down from the hill, turning over and over. Everything inside falls from the floor onto the ceiling and back — and crashes.

Metal Spherical Hill.

> 

I blew up the hill we are now in space. Ahaha ha says the Emperor

Also Grand Admaral Thawn Legends Version is in command

Unhappily, the explosion was too powerful, and the remains of Death Star with the Emperor and Thawn fly away into space.

Blown Hill.

The Death Star fired like it did at Alderaan Far Way! 

Everyone is safe with the fleets. And Death Star II with fleets are also fine

Two Death Star produce a significant gravity.  

It pulls them together...

Spoiler

Metal Scrap Hill
They have repulser lifts and are far enough away they don't attack gravity but can still provide support

Thermodynamics kicks in just as the Death Star(s?) fire at a planet. The immense power overwhelms the heat rejection systems and the fleet becomes… *very warm*. A few hundred thousand Kelvins, perhaps. It expands and radiates to reach equilibrium with the CMBR.

Physics' hill of energy.
